problems.title: Problem 1
problems.content: Consider the circuit shown in. Suppose that

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: What percentage of the initial energy stored in the inductor is eventually dissipated in the 40 Ω resistor?
parts.need: Express your answer as a percentage using three significant figures.

problems.title: Problem 2
problems.content: The two switches in the circuit seen in (Figure 1) are synchronized. The switches have been closed for a long time before opening at t=0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: How many microseconds after the switches are open is the energy dissipated in the 4 kΩ resistor <input id='p2-a-percent' type='number'> % of the initial energy stored in the 6  H inductor?
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: What percentage of the total energy stored in the inductor at the calculated time has been dissipated?
parts.need: Express your answer using three significant figures.

problems.title: Problem 3
problems.content: In the circuit in (Figure 1), the voltage and current expressions are v = <input id='p3-V' type='number'> e<sup><input id='p3-e1' type='number'>t</sup>V, t≥0+; i = <input id='p3-I' type='number'> e<sup><input id='p3-e2' type='number'>t</sup>A, t≥0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find R.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find τ (in milliseconds).
parts.need: Express your answer in milliseconds to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find L.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Find the initial energy stored in the inductor.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Find the time (in milliseconds) it takes to dissipate <input id='p3-e-percent' type='number'> % of the initial stored energy.
parts.need: Express your answer in milliseconds to three significant figures.

problems.title: Problem 4
problems.content: The switch shown in (Figure 1) has been open for a long time before closing at t = 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Write the expression for the capacitor voltage, v(t), for t≥0.
parts.need: Express your answer in terms of t, where t is in seconds.

problems.title: Problem 5
problems.content: The switch in the circuit has been in position 1 for a long time before moving to position 2 at t=0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Select the correct expression for i<sub>0</sub> (t) for t≥0+.

problems.title: Problem 6
problems.content: In the circuit in (Figure 1), the voltage and current expressions are v = <input id='p6-V' type='number'> e<sup><input id='p6-e1' type='number'>t</sup>V, t≥0+; i = <input id='p6-I' type='number'> e<sup><input id='p6-e2' type='number'>t</sup>mA, t≥0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find R.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find C.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find τ (in milliseconds).
parts.need: Express your answer in milliseconds to three significant figures.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Find the initial energy stored in the capacitor.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Find the amount of energy that has been dissipated by the resistor <input id='p6-e-t' type='number'> ms after the voltage begins to decay.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 7
problems.content: The switch in the circuit in (Figure 1) has been open a long time before closing at t = 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Select the correct expression for v<sub>0</sub> (t) for t≥0+.

problems.title: Problem 8
problems.content: Assume that the switch in the circuit of (Figure 1) has been in position a for a long time and that at t = 0 it is moved to position b.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Find v<sub>C</sub>(0<sup>+</sup>).
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find τ for t>0.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find v<sub>C</sub>(∞).
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Find i(0<sup>+</sup>).
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Choose the correct expression for v<sub>C</sub>, t≥0.

parts.title: Part F
parts.content: Choose the correct expression for i, t≥0+.

problems.title: Problem 9
problems.content: The switch in the circuit has been in position a for a long time. At t=0 the switch is moved to position b.(Figure 1)

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Calculate the initial voltage on the capacitor if
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Calculate the final voltage on the capacitor.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Calculate the time constant for t>0.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Calculate the length of time required for the capacitor voltage to reach zero after the switch is moved to position b.
parts.need: Express your answer with the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 10
problems.content: Assume that the switch in the circuit in (Figure 1) has been in the ON position for a long time before switching instantaneously to the OFF position at t= 0.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Select the correct expression for v<sub>0</sub>(t) for t≥0.

problems.title: Problem 11
problems.content: The switch in the circuit has been in position x for a long time. The initial charge on the 60 nF capacitor is zero. At t=0, the switch moves instantaneously to position y.(Figure 1)

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Select the correct expression for v<sub>0</sub>(t) for t≥0<sup>+</sup>.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Select the correct expression for v<sub>1</sub>(t) for t≥0.
